intro: Gypsophila alpestris, commonly known as the baby's breath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. Its slender stems and small, fluffy flowers make it a popular choice in floral arrangements. Gypsophila alpestris is also valued for its ornamental use in gardens and as a cut flower due to its long-lasting blooms.
